title: "la Ford" newspaper font
content:
please...   
 ![font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33713.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Location of "infinity" symbol {Chesh, Richard}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105149/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4322 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Le Bar" typesetting request ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105149/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4335 "Go to next forum topic")
author: okr

comments.content:
The r is reminiscent of something by Jim Parkinson,   
perhaps Bureau Grotesque.

This has the grotesque no. 9 and FB Bureaugrotesque feel. Perhaps someone modified the l and the d and made them pointy. I think the Bureau Grotesques were designed by David Berlow for whatever that's worth.

You're right, Berlow, my bad ...   
   
bj

Here's a sample of BureauGrot. Three Seven Compressed slightly with the applied modifications. It's not exact but I think you can see you can achieve the desired result:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33731.jpg)
